body:
# elm-conf is going virtual!

## elm-conf returns July 15–17 for three days of talks, workshops, and open spaces. Everyone is welcome; join us from the comfort of your own home!

<buttons>
  <button link="/register" text="Buy Tickets" />
</buttons>

## Wednesday, July 15

On **Wednesday** we’ll be hosting a free, online version of Elm Bridge.
If you’ve been curious about Elm—or functional programming in general—this is the perfect opportunity to learn before the main conference.
We’ll have limited spots for this event, and will be giving preference to people from underrepresented and marginalized groups.

## Thursday and Friday, July 16–17

On **Thursday** and **Friday** we’ll be online all day with a mix of talks, discussions, hacking, and workshops.
Both mornings will start off with talks from well-known and new faces from the Elm community, then transition into remote workshops, group discussions, social time, and open spaces for collaborating on projects.

<buttons>
  <button link="/register" text="Buy Tickets" />
</buttons>

## Sounds great, I'm in!

Hooray!
Early bird tickets are on sale now and the [call for speakers](/submit/talk) is open now through **June 1st**.
Once speakers and workshops are announced, the price will go up, so get in early!

Talks and workshops will take place during the US day on July 16th and 17th. We'll set times such that it's convenient for people from roughly US Eastern to US Pacific time to attend.

<tito-widget event="elm-conf/2020"></tito-widget>

[Are you a student or a member of an underrepresented group? See here for details on other ways to attend elm-conf.](/register)
